title: Counting Sort
subject: Algorithms
theory:
If we know data range (e.g., integers 0-100), we don't need to compare. 
1. Count frequency of each value.
2. Reconstruct array. 
Breaks the O(n log n) barrier.

common_mistakes.correction: If range (k) is huge (e.g., all 64-bit ints), memory blows up. Use radix sort.

summary: Fastest sort for small integer ranges.
